Raghav Sethi

I'm a software engineer at Airtable, a tool to democratize software creation.

Previously, I was at Facebook, where I worked on Presto, an open-source distributed SQL query engine. Before that, I was a grad student in Computer Science at Princeton, advised by Dr. Michael Freedman. I completed my bachelor's degree at IIIT-Delhi.

Send me an email (GPG), or follow me on Twitter. Sometimes I take pictures that turn out okay.

Notes

Why metrics are hard (and what to do about it)  July 1, 2018

Papers

Presto: SQL on Everything [web]
Raghav Sethi, Martin Traverso, Dain Sundstrom, David Phillips, Wenlei Xie, Yutian Sun, Nezih Yigitbasi, Haozhun Jin, Eric Hwang, Nileema Shingte, Christopher Berner. In IEEE International Conference on Data Engineering (ICDE), Macau SAR. 2019.

Be Fast, Cheap and in Control with SwitchKV [pdf] [web]
Xiaozhou Li, Raghav Sethi, Michael Kaminsky, David G. Andersen and Michael J. Freedman. In 13th USENIX Symposium on Networked Systems Design and Implementation (NSDI), Santa Clara, CA. 2016.

WhACKY! - What Anyone Could Know About You from Twitter [pdf]
Denzil Correa, Ashish Surekha and Raghav Sethi. In Proceedings of the 10th Annual Conference on Privacy, Security and Trust (PST), Paris, France. 2012.
